original_title: Five men arrested for gold smuggling aboard Chennai-bound flight
original_body_lines: COLOMBO (News 1st); The Narcotics Control Unit of Sri Lanka Customs detained five businessmen from Colombo on gold smuggling charges.

Sri Lanka Customs said that based on a tip-off received from a reliable source, five Channa-bound passengers were intercepted inside the flight for the possession of gold in the form of gel, concealed in their person.
The Narcotics Control Unit of Sri Lanka Customs recovered 15 capsules with a total weight of 5.65 kg.
Sri Lanka Customs said that the value of the gold is approximately Rs. 107 Million.
The five men were to travel to Chennai, India aboard Indigo Air flight 6E1176.
Rs.30 billion in outstanding bills for medicine – Health Sec.
